results.title: Winning
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and David Morgan
results.brief_description: Two mentally handicapped people from Hotham House, Victoria, marry. Film deals with the problems they face and the help they receive when they leave the home and move into their own flat.

results.title: Winner: Problem solving - measurement
results.brief_description: Animated film which visualizes the concept of measurement and rates. Illustrates the usefulness of constructing scale models to estimate a solution. Demonstrates how to use a calculator to compare data and solve problems.

results.title: Wings under test
results.creator_credit: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (Australia). Information Service and S.T. Evans
results.brief_description: A summarized version is included in a later film entitled “Structural fatigue and air safety”. The method and equipment developed by the Division of Aeronautics to test large aircraft wings for airworthiness requirements, resistance to fatigue and ultimate static strength.

results.title: Wings to the future
results.brief_description: Principle features and event of the 1962 Farmborough Air Show. British aircraft on display included the Hawker P-1277, Bristol Type 188, Vickers VC10, de Havilland Trident, de Havilland 125 jet and the Beagle 218. Many others craft are seen on the ground and in the air, and supersonic fighters of the Armed Services give a thrilling display of aerobatics as a finale.

results.title: Wings to Italy
results.creator_credit: Ideal Pictures (US), Coleman Productions and Harry L. Coleman
results.brief_description: Points of interest ot the tourist in Italy are seen as a young couple reminisce about their vacation trip. Includes Rome, Vesuvius, Pompeii, Capri, Pisa, Siena, Florence, the Dolomites and Venice.

results.title: Wings to Bermuda
results.creator_credit: Pan American World Airways and Harry L. Coleman
results.brief_description: A young couple spend their honeymoon in Bermuda. The camera follows them as they observe the beauty of the island’s flower gardens, visit caves, play golf, swim, surf or water ski. Exploring the hidden world bellows the sea is a highlight of the tour, as is a midnight barbecue under a full Bermuda moon.

results.title: Wings over the navy
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Australian Naval Aviation - of the carrier HMAS Sydney - and of he intricate and intensive training given to the men who men her and the pilots who fly her aircraft.

results.title: Wings for tomorrow
results.brief_description: The importance of models in aviation is depicted, showing that although they give enjoyment to the enthusiasts who make and fly them, they also give very valuable training to designers, technicians, and flyers, both present and future. It shows how the crew members of today get their early graining, in many instances, flying models of yesterday. Various models from gliders to jets are shown, both on the ground, and in the air.

results.title: Wings across the world
results.creator_credit: Norman Swallow, BBC and Anthony de Lotbinière
results.brief_description: An account of world-wide commercial aviation showing how it operates and is controlled. The aim of the International Civil Aviation Organization is to establish and maintain standards of safety and comfort. Film includes sequences shot in Bolivia, Afghanistan, Beirut, Montreal and Switzerland, along the new routes of the North Pole, at London Airport and in Venezuela. The impact of air travel on primitive peoples, in particular on an Abyssinian peasant who had never seen a railway or a real road.
